Technique: FORMED BY HAND; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Jar
Description: Pottery vessel with rounded base, globular body, short vertical neck, wide outward flaring quatrefoil mouth. This jar was placed, presumably with offerings, in a tomb of the early Middle Kingdom at Abydos. Several other pottery vessels in this collection are marked as coming from the same tomb, which must then have been of some wealth.
